full_text: Screened by NARA, 8/15/2023 PLEASE CHANGE ADDRESS.TO If your tax identification or Social Security number is missing or incr the revers side of this statement please enter the correct numbithbal mong with the hyphans II the account is in more than one name underline or circle the name of the person whose number is used New.Address City State Zip Under penalties of perjury I certify (1) that the number shown on this form 15 my correct taxpayer Identification number and (2) that I am not subject to THE DIVIDEND OPTION TO: backup withholding either because I have not been notified that am subject to backup withholding as a result of a failure to report all interest or dividends or the Internal Revenue Service has nothed me that I am no longer subject Reinvestment of dividends and capital gains to backup withholding 2 Congening reinvested 3 All Shareholder Signature Date Shareholder Signature Date Shareholder Signature Date Shareholder Signature Date ALL SHAREHOLDERS MUST SIGN TO EFFECT ANY CHANGES TO ACCOUNT CONFIRMATIONS, STATEMENTS AND CERTIFICATES All purchases of Fund shares will be confirmed and credited to an account in your name by The First Jersey National Bank in full and fractional shares of the Fund (rounded to the nearest 1/1000 of a share) Certificates will not be issued unless you request them in writing to The First Jersey National Bank No certificates will be issued to you for fractional shares HOW TO USE YOUR ACCOUNT You may make additional Investments in your account through your account executive in amounts of $100 or more or by simply attaching your check in the amount of $100 or more and sending it to The First Jersey National Bank along with the stub attached to this confirmation Do NOT send contributions for IRA's and self-employed retirement plans to The First Jersey National Bank unless the Bank is the custodian or trustee of your plan. Contributions should be payable to and sent to the respective custodian or trustee DIVIDENDS Dividends will be automatically reinvested in additional shares at net asset value unless The First Jersey National Bank has been informed of the shareholder's desire to have cash payout The distribution option currently on your account is indicated near the top of the plan statement To avoid being subject to a 20% federal withholding tax on taxable dividends, capital gains distributions and proceeds of redemptions shareholders' taxpayer Identification numbers must be furnished and certified as to accuracy REDEMPTION OF SHARES Shares of the Fund may be redeemed at net asset value at any time by sending a written request to The First Jersey National Bank or by contacting your account executive If redemption is requested by a corporation partnership trustee or fiduciary the Agent may require written evidence of authority to act be submitted before such request will be accepted Also a redemption of shares cannot be settled unless the shares are held in your account or the certificates for same are returned to The First Jersey National Bank A contingent deferred sales charge may be imposed an any redemption by an investor which reduces the current value of the investor's shares of the Fund to an amount which is lower than the dollar amount of all payments by the shareholder for the purchase of Fund shares during the preceding six years. However, no such charge will be imposed to the extent that the net asset value of the shares redeemed does not exceed (a) the current net asset value of shares purchased more than six years prior to the redemption plus (b) the current net asset value of shares purchased through reinvestment of dividends or distributions plus (c) increases in the net asset value of the investor's shares above the total amount of payments for the purchase of Fund shares made during the preceding six years For a detailed description of the contingent deferred sales charge including the amount of any such charge please see the current prospectus of the Fund SHAREHOLDERS LIVING OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES If you are an American citizen living outside the United States and have not advised The First Jersey National Bank of your citizenship the Bank is required by the Internal Revenue Service to withhold a nonresident allen tax on any dividends paid to you. Amounts withheld for nonresident alien taxes will have an asterisk (*) next to them on this statement and these amounts will not be included in the federal tax withheld total FORM 54012 (7785)
